has nothing to do with the topic at hand.

Well, if you noticed, the minions actually do go after them.

They just break their range before they're hit. Usually. Except the casters end up still hitting them.

Minion aggro is very inconsistent but it has nothing to do with being melee or ranged. Regardless of who you're playing, sometimes the minions will literally chase you into your tower after you get aggro'd, and sometimes they will auto you once and then give up. I am a victim of this, as someone who constantly finds themselves not going through with trades due to knowing that if i fight back i will be fucked over by the enemy minions while MY minions are completely oblivious to me getting killed.
Use the bush to break aggro lol.
That's one of the big disadvantages of playing melee vs ranged.

Remember when they changed the minion AI to help in ranged vs melee match ups.  
Remember how it made it worse
2 years ago I don't recall. Exactly
